comment: Best Professor I have had at KSU.She actively works to create relationships with each student and involve them in class.Her classes are a lot of work but it will benefit you in the long run. She genuinely cares and is so supportive.Stay up to date with deadlines, attend class, and READ.I have taken her twice and I would do it all again! Love her!

Dr Rodriguez is a literal angel on earth, if I could have her as my only professor for the rest of my career, I would. The class is pretty hard but READ. THE. TEXTBOOK. BEFORE. EXAMS (and take good notes from it) and you will do great. She is there to help whether it has to do with school or your personal life. She cares about her students so much
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: I really do not know why Dr. Rodriguez's score is so low because she is amazing. A huge chunk of your grade is made up of a group project so it is very important to find a group of good people. I really enjoyed her class and loved having conversations. She also had an amazing TA and he was so helpful. Dr. Rodriguez truly cares about her students!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Not sure if the class changed after COVID but it's not as hard as the older comments claim it to be. The project requires a lot of time/effort but she gives detailed feedback so always ask for her feedback before submitting assignments. I did well on all the exams bc we had an amazing TA but reading the textbook helped me a lot for short responses.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Don't let the bad reviews intimidate you. I had Dr. Rodgriguez for multiple years and felt so welcomed and supported by her. She wants you to succeed so she pushes you. Yes, her assignments can be difficult but they are easily doable if you take her feedback. Her projects have helped me obtain a real world job and they give you fantastic experience
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Literally the WORST class and professor I have had at KSU. This is suppose to be an intro class into nonprofits and it was more like a graduate level, advanced class. You have to create your own nonprofit which was outrageously difficult, then it is ripped to shreds by brutal "sharks" she recruits as if you've worked in the industry for 10+ years.

You are going to have to work for your grade!!!That being said, Rodriguez is a great teacher and cares a lot. Group project will consume your life lol, but very possible with time and effort. Tests are pretty easy if you read the textbook. This class isnt as hard as other people make it out to be. Easy to pass if you are willing to put in the work!

This class was not easy in any way. It was the only class this semester that i didnt get an A in and was very upset about it. You have to work crazy hard for even a passing grade. However, if you do the study guides correctly you will pass the class. Beware of the group project. It is long and annoying and you never even get a real grade for them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: This is a difficult class no matter who the professor is. That being said, theres always conflicting info and the class is disorganized. Dr. Rodriguez is pretty removed from everything. She's knowledgeable but take a more involved professor. 1 large group project, 1 paper and 4 exams. 2 assignments are dropped (not group the project)

Dr. Rodriguez is absolutely amazing. She is so caring and funny. She really cares for your best interest. However, this course content was ridiculous. The class became my entire life. The group project consumed everything for the entire semester. If you put in the exorbitant amount of time needed to do well in this class, you will.

Dr. Rodriguez is informative, nice, and helpful. The content is TOUGH. A huge portion of your grade relies on a grade from a group project, which I do not feel is fair. She canceled class quite a few times and still expected us to work on our projects without us learning what we missed in class. It is not a "teach your self" subject. ASK FOR HELP!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Rodriguez's class is NO JOKE. You will feel like she is out to get you at first, but by the end of the semester, you'll realize that she's preparing you for what's ahead. DO the extra credit and talk to her after every class. Study more than usual. PICK GROUP MEMBERS WHO WILL DO THE WORK and think ahead on your project's budget. Best of luck!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is the absolute worst professor I have ever had. The semester before mine I heard she went crazy and made everyone start taking tests at home with a camera recorded them, then she decided to let everyone the next semester use their notes. she told me to go get tested for a disability because I didnt do well on her tests. Almost everyone got a C

Yes, the classes Dr. R teaches are hard, but what in life is easy? However, they are doable. She does her job which is to prepare students for the workforce. An added bonus is she genuinely cares about her students and their success.

Class was switched to basically all online even though we signed up for and wanted a face-to-face class. She worked with us with technology and assignment issues, but I feel like I didn't learn as much as I could've. She also has a terrible grade turn around. I saw 2 grades in D2L for the entire semester even though we had around 20 assignments.

I really love Darlene. She honestly cares about her students and wants them to do well. BUT this class will become your life. PICK YOUR GROUP WISELY. The group project is the largest part of the class. READ READ READ. She does give extra credit which acts as a curve on her tests. DO THEM. Like I said--she cares about you. Go to here if you need
Hard teacher. Thinks her class is the only one you have. Redicoulous amount of work, tests are almost impassable, and you have a camera on you when you take the exam online!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: TAKE. HER. AT. YOUR. PERIL! RUN. FOR. THE. HILLS!! Ridiculous amount of busy work. Exams are extremely hard. Shark Tank group project that will have going crazy. Docs points if you're late or misses class. Fills your inbox with countless emails and follow-ups about random stuff. Very overbearing to say the least, I wouldn't take her again. Period.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! She seems very nice and funny at first but she makes the class unbearably difficult. She must think that HS2200 is the only class her students are taking and they don't have lives or work or ANYTHING ELSE. She is also very confusing when it comes to instructions. Save your sanity and stress levels and take someone else.

An undergraduate class taught at graduate level. Avoid her if you can. She makes everything more difficult that it really is. She's passionate about her subject and very knowledgeable too. But her job is to make the class very hard. She literally told us on the first day of class her class is hard that if we wanted to drop it we should do so early!

This is one of the hardest classes I've taken BUT Dr. R is one of the most passionate professors I have ever had. She tells you first day of class it will not be an easy class. Read the chapters before class,  do not procrastinate, and do the extra credit. I worked my butt off for a good grade but l learned SO much. Overall I'm glad I took her

She is a good professor. The class is definitely hard, but if you work really hard for your grade then you will probably do fine. She really helps you to understand the text during her lectures. There's not that many tests in her class, but other assignments and extra credit quizzes and assignments help. I probably would take her again.

Darlene is a fabulous professor if you are willing to try and work for your grade. She really cares about her students, and is very accessible if you have any questions or need clarification. Yes, the work is hard, but she as a person is a great person, and I would take her again in a heartbeat.
Darlene is an awesome professor. She is definitely hard and intense, but she is passionate. She truly cares about her students and she really does try to help them succeed.

She only taught this class one semester prior to the spring semester and she is not the right professor for this course. She makes the class harder than it has to be and expects her students to be on a PHD level. BEWARE if you can!

Horrible instructor! Worst ever!!! The only positive thing that I can say is that she is available to speak to but the content of that encounter will be pointless. There are no clear directions to the assignments and her feedback is illegible. Her critique of people's work is based on PhD level expectations for a menial degree..
